verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David the servant of Jehovah. The transgression <S%H6588><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> saith <S%H5002><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%>, There is no fear <S%H6343><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> before his eyes <S%H5869><s%>.
For he flattereth <S%H2505><s%> himself in his own eyes <S%H5869><s%>, That his iniquity <S%H5771><s%> will not be found <S%H4672><s%> out and be hated <S%H8130><s%>.
The words <S%H1697><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> are iniquity <S%H205><s%> and deceit <S%H4820><s%>: He hath ceased <S%H2308><s%> to be wise <S%H7919><s%> and to do good <S%H3190><s%>.

He deviseth <S%H2803><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> upon his bed <S%H4904><s%>; He setteth <S%H3320><s%> himself in a way <S%H1870><s%> that is not good <S%H2896><s%>; He abhorreth <S%H3988><s%> not evil <S%H7451><s%>.
Thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, is in the heavens <S%H8064><s%>; Thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%> reacheth unto the skies <S%H7834><s%>.

Thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> is like the mountains <S%H2042><s%> of God <S%H410><s%>; Thy judgments <S%H4941><s%> are a great <S%H7227><s%> deep <S%H8415><s%>: O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, thou preservest <S%H3467><s%> man <S%H120><s%> and beast <S%H929><s%>.

How precious <S%H3368><s%> is thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>! And the children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> take refuge <S%H2620><s%> under the shadow <S%H6738><s%> of thy wings <S%H3671><s%>.

They shall be abundantly satisfied <S%H7301><s%> with the fatness <S%H1880><s%> of thy house <S%H1004><s%>; And thou wilt make them drink <S%H8248><s%> of the river <S%H5158><s%> of thy pleasures <S%H5730><s%>.
For with thee is the fountain <S%H4726><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>: In thy light <S%H216><s%> shall we see <S%H7200><s%> light <S%H216><s%>.
Oh continue <S%H4900><s%> thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> unto them that know <S%H3045><s%> thee <S%H6666><s%>, And thy righteousness to the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%>.
Let not the foot <S%H7272><s%> of pride <S%H1346><s%> come <S%H935><s%> against me <S%H3027><s%>, And let not the hand of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> drive me away <S%H5110><s%>.
There are the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> fallen <S%H5307><s%>: They are thrust down <S%H1760><s%>, and shall not be able <S%H3201><s%> to rise <S%H6965><s%>.
